p: The antifungal activity was determined against C. albicans ATCC 10,231 and Malassezia furfur ATCC 14521. All tested samples showed an interesting antifungal activity against C. albicans and M. furfur, with MIC values ranging from 54.56 to 0.240 mg/mL. In particular, Grade 2 essential oil from Najdi and Grade 1 essential oil from Sahli showed MIC values at the lowest tested concentration corresponding to a percentage v/ v of 0.03 (â‰¤0.252 mg/mL) against both fungal pathogens. The data were shown in the Table 4.
